question: Under Article 333 of the Constitution, the Governor of a State is allowed to nominate how many members of Anglo-Indian Community to Legislative Assembly of the State?
option3: Up to one-twelfth of total membership of House
option4: Any number, it is left to the personal discretion of the Governor
explanation: Article 333 of the Constitution provides the Governor with power to nominate one member of Anglo Indian Community to State Legislative Assembly.
